data.title: Fatal Run (Atari 7800) - online game
data.meta_description: In this post-apocalyptic driving/racing game you must travel to various towns delivering medicine, while on your way to a missile base which houses a rocket th
data.text:
In this post-apocalyptic driving/racing game you must travel to various towns delivering medicine, while on your way to a missile base which houses a rocket that can save the world. While driving through the 32 levels, you'll meet countless enemies who want to stop you from achieving your goal. Your car boasts many weapons to help you out, including dynamite, rockets, oil slicks, smoke screens, and machine guns. You can also upgrade your vehicle within the city shops. Upgrading your gas tank provides better mileage while upgrading your bumper protects you during collisions. A password feature let's you continue where you left off.

More details about this game can be found on MobyGames.com.

This verÂ­sion of Fatal Run was deÂ­sigÂ­ned for AÂ­taÂ­ri 7800, which was viÂ­deo gaÂ­me conÂ­soÂ­le of third geÂ­neÂ­raÂ­tion maÂ­nuÂ­facÂ­tuÂ­red by AÂ­taÂ­ri in the years 1984 - 1992. It was fulÂ­ly backÂ­ward-comÂ­paÂ­tiÂ­ble with the AÂ­taÂ­ri 2600 with siÂ­gÂ­niÂ­fiÂ­cantÂ­ly imÂ­proÂ­ved graÂ­phics hardÂ­waÂ­re. HowÂ­eÂ­ver, the conÂ­soÂ­le was not sucÂ­cesÂ­sÂ­ful and less than 4 milÂ­liÂ­on uÂ­nits at a uÂ­nit priÂ­ce of $ 80 weÂ­re sold. AlÂ­so the curÂ­rent gaÂ­mes liÂ­braÂ­ry conÂ­taiÂ­nes less than 100 gaÂ­mes deÂ­sigÂ­ned for AÂ­taÂ­ri 7800. MoÂ­re inÂ­forÂ­maÂ­tiÂ­on aÂ­bout the this conÂ­soÂ­le can be found here.

You can control this game easily by using the keyboard of your PC (see the table next to the game). However, for maximum gaming enjoyment, we strongly recommend using a USB gamepad that you simply plug into the USB port of your computer. If you do not have a gamepad, buy a suitable USB controller in Amazon or AliExpress or in some of your favorite online stores.

3 different online emulators are available for Fatal Run. These emulators differ not only in the technology they use to emulate old games, but also in support of various game controllers, multiplayer mode, mobile phone touchscreen, emulation speed, absence or presence of embedded ads and in many other parameters. For maximum gaming enjoyment, it's important to choose the right emulator, because on each PC and in different Internet browsers, the individual emulators behave differently.
